definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
net-like object/to hold sth in place with a net/to wind/to twist/(TCM) channels in the human body

sentences.english: New car sales have heated up this summer.
sentences.chinese: 今年夏天的新车销售热络了起来。

sentences.english: The gold trade is getting crowded, though.
sentences.chinese: 不过黄金交易正在变得过于热络。

sentences.english: Scientists are scrambling to decipher this versatile molecule.
sentences.chinese: 科学家们正热络地破译这种多功能分子。

sentences.english: The boy is warming up to the machine, and that’s the point.
sentences.chinese: 男孩正跟机器人热络起来，而这正是关键所在。

sentences.english: Treasuries are heavily traded on financial markets.
sentences.chinese: 在金融市场上，此等债券的交易十分热络。

definition: to exchange conventional greetings/to exchange pleasantries
to get along well (with sb)/congenial/to speculate (on financial markets)
harmonious/friendly relations/on good terms with one another
to be well acquainted with/to know well
to worm one's way into being friends with sb (usually derogatory)
